ACCIDENT RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES

Vaquero Midstream LLC owns and Vaquero Permian Processing LLC operates a natural gas processing plant, the Caymus Natural Gas Processing Facility, in Reeves County, Texas. The plant is designed to process natural gas and recover liquid product from natural gas by physical separation and cryogenic means. Petroleum condensates are transported to another facility for processing.

Vaquero Permian Processing, LLC has a long-standing commitment to worker and public safety. This commitment is demonstrated by our efforts in accident prevention, such as training personnel, quality assurance, and considering safety in the design, installation, operation and maintenance of our process. Our policy is to implement reasonable controls to prevent foreseeable releases of regulated substances. However if a release does occur, facility trained personnel will evaluate the situation, take actions within the capabilities of the facility, and notify the necessary outside agencies.


DESCRIPTION OF STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES

The Caymus Natural Gas Processing Facility is located near Coyanosa, Texas and operates a variety of processes to produce the following petroleum products:
- Propane
- NGLs
- Condensate
- Residue Gas

These substances can contain the following regulated chemicals:
- Methane
- Ethane
- Propane
- i-Butane
- n-Butane
- i-Pentane
- n-Pentane


GENERAL ACCIDENT RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM

A. Employee Participation

Vaquero Permian Processing, LLC encourages employees to participate in all facets of process safety management and accident prevention as follows:
1. Updating and compiling technical documents and chemical information;
2. Performing necessary calculations for PSM and RMP;
3. Maintaining good engineering practices; and
4. Participating as a member of a process hazard analysis (PHA) team.

3. Notification of local emergency response agencies and the public if a release occurs.

Employees receive training in the procedures to be followed by employees who remain to operate critical plant operations before they evacuate. Vaquero Permian Processing, LLC has around-the-clock communication capability with appropriate emergency response organizations (Fire Department, Police Department, Sheriff's Office, or similar). This interface provides the means of notifying the public of an incident, if necessary, as well as facilitating quick response to an incident. In addition, Vaquero Permian Processing, LLC conducts periodic emergency drills and refresher training for plant personnel.

N. PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

Vaquero Permian Processing, LLC's management is committed to the following:
-Preventing accidents;
-Training our employees in correct response procedures in the event of an accident;
-Participating in community emergency preparedness; and
-Addressing any citizen concerns by fully explaining potential hazards associated with Vaquero Permian Processing, LLC operations and all steps being taken to prevent and mitigate accidents.

With these objectives in mind, this Risk Management Plan has been developed to provide information about our management of the risks associated with the natural gas treatment and liquids recovery process. Most importantly, we stress our commitment to ensuring a safe operation for our employees, our visitors, and our community.

The team's findings are forwarded to Vaquero Permian Processing, LLC Management for resolution. The approved mitigation options in response to the PHA team's findings are tracked until they are completed. The final resolution of each finding is documented and retained.

The facility periodically updates and revalidates the PHA. These periodic reviews are conducted at least every 5 years and will be conducted at this frequency until the process is no longer operating. The results and findings from these updates are documented and retained.

D. Operating Procedures

Vaquero Permian Processing, LLC maintains written Operating Procedures of the covered processes that address primary operations mandated by OSHA, EPA, Good Engineering Practice, and manufacturers' specifications. These procedures can be used as a reference by experienced operators and provide a basis for consistent training of new operators. Procedures are periodically reviewed and annually certified as current and accurate by management. The procedures are maintained current and accurate, revising them as necessary by employee suggestion, compliance audit, PHAs, Good Engineering practice, Pre-Startup Safety Review (PSSR) and implementing them through Management of Change.

Covered Process Operating Procedures are readily available to operators in the process unit and for other personnel to use as necessary to safely perform their job task and maintain the covered process unit operating within its safe limits.

E. Training

Vaquero Permian Processing, LLC has implemented a comprehensive training program for all employees involved in operating the covered processes. New employees receive basic training in process operations if they are not already familiar with such operations. After successfully comp

A PSSR involves field verification of the construction and serves as quality assurance and verification that the accident prevention program requirements are properly implemented.

H. Safe Work Practices

Vaquero Permian Processing, LLC has standing safe work practices as mandated by OSHA, EPA, Industrial Standards, and Good Engineering Practice in place to help provide employee, public, and process safety.

I. Management of Change

Vaquero Permian Processing, LLC has a comprehensive system to manage changes to all covered processes. This system requires that changes to items such as process equipment, chemicals, technology, and procedures be properly reviewed and authorized before being implemented. Changes are reviewed to:
1. Determine that adequate controls are in place to manage any new hazards; and
2. Verify that existing controls have not been compromised by the proposed change.

Affected chemical hazard information, process operating limits, and equipment information and procedures are updated to incorporate these changes. In addition, operating and maintenance personnel are trained on the changes.

J. Incident Investigation

Vaquero Permian Processing, LLC promptly investigates all incidents related to a covered process that resulted in, or reasonably could have resulted in a fire/explosion, property damage, environmental loss or personal injury. The goal of each investigation is to determine the facts and develop corrective action to prevent a recurrence of the incident or a similar incident.
